page.title: 17St. Andrews Church
page.content: The early history of St.Andrews, the parish church of Sherborne St. John is not clear. It is thought a church was built on the site about 1150 and the south and west walls, the south door of the nave and the font remain from this date. The church is built of flint and stone with a brick chapel, porch and vestry. The tower was first built in 1250 and contains six bells, the two oldest cast in 1587. The chancel was added in 1300, and in 1420 the Brocas Chapel was built as a family mausoleum. The sanctuary is a memorial to one Richard Attkins. The south porch was built in 1533. The fine pulpit dated 1634 is unusual as it is signed by its maker. The north aisle was built in 1854 to provide work for the parish. The lychgate was built to celebrate Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee.
